paragraph.target: 月はずっと昇っていた、しかし彼は眠り続けた、そして魚は着実に引っ張り続けた、船は雲のトンネルの中へと進んでいった。

paragraph.source: He woke with the jerk of his right fist coming up against his face and the line burning out through his right hand.
paragraph.target: 彼は右のこぶしが顔にぶつかる衝撃で目を覚ました。そして糸が右手を通り抜けて焼けるように感じた。

paragraph.source: He had no feeling of his left hand but he braked all he could with his right and the line rushed out.
paragraph.target: 左手には感覚がなかったが、彼は右手でできる限りブレーキをかけ、糸は勢いよく出ていった。

paragraph.source: Finally his left hand found the line and he leaned back against the line and now it burned his back and his left hand, and his left hand was taking all the strain and cutting badly.
paragraph.target: やがて左手が糸をつかみ、彼は糸に体を預けた。すると糸は背中と左手を焼くように痛めつけ、左手がすべての負荷を受けてひどく切れていた。

paragraph.source: He looked back at the coils of line and they were feeding smoothly.
paragraph.target: 彼は後ろの糸の巻きを見たが、それは滑らかに出ていた。

paragraph.source: Just then the fish jumped making a great bursting of the ocean and then a heavy fall.
paragraph.target: その時、魚が跳ねて大きな海の爆発音を立て、そして重く落ちた。

paragraph.source: Then he jumped again and again and the boat was going fast although line was still racing out and the old man was raising the strain to breaking point and raising it to breaking point again and again.
paragraph.target: 魚は何度も何度も跳ね、糸はまだ勢いよく出ているのに船は速く進んでいた。老人は負荷を限界まで高め、また何度も限界まで高めていた。

paragraph.source: He had been pulled down tight onto the bow and his face was in the cut slice of dolphin and he could not move.
paragraph.target: 彼はきつく船首に引き寄せられ、顔はイルカの切り身のように切れた部分に押し付けられ、動けなかった。

paragraph.source: This is what we waited for, he thought.
paragraph.target: これこそが、私たちが待っていたものだと彼は思った。

paragraph.source: So now let us take it.
paragraph.target: さあ、今こそそれを手に入れよう。

paragraph.source: Make him pay for the line, he thought.
paragraph.target: 糸の代償を払わせろ、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Make him pay for it.
paragraph.target: その代償を払わせろ。

paragraph.source: He could not see the fish's jumps but only heard the breaking of the ocean and the heavy splash as he fell.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚の跳ねる姿を見ることはできず、ただ海が割れる音と、魚が落ちるときの重い水しぶきだけを聞いていた。

paragraph.source: The speed of the line was cutting his hands badly but he had always known this would happen and he tried to keep the cutting across the calloused parts and not let the line slip into the palm nor cut the fingers.
paragraph.target: 糸の速さは彼の手をひどく切りつけていたが、彼はこれが起こることをずっと知っていて、硬くなった部分に沿って切れるようにし、糸が手のひらに滑り込んだり指を切ったりしないように努めていた。

paragraph.source: If the boy was here he would wet the coils of line, he thought.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいれば、彼は糸の輪を濡らすだろうと、彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Yes.
paragraph.target: そうだ。

paragraph.source: If the boy were here.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいれば。

paragraph.source: If the boy were here.
paragraph.target: もし少年がここにいれば。

paragraph.source: The line went out and out and out but it was slowing now and he was making the fish earn each inch of it.
paragraph.target: 糸はどんどん出ていったが、今は速度が落ちてきていて、老人は魚に一インチずつ稼がせていた。

paragraph.source: Now he got his head up from the wood and out of the slice of fish that his cheek had crushed.
paragraph.target: 今、彼は木片から頭を上げ、頬が押しつぶした魚の切れ端から離れた。

paragraph.source: Then he was on his knees and then he rose slowly to his feet.
paragraph.target: それから彼はひざまずき、ゆっくりと立ち上がった。

paragraph.source: He was ceding line but more slowly all the time.
paragraph.target: 彼は糸を譲っていたが、その速度は次第に遅くなっていた。

paragraph.source: He worked back to where he could feel with his foot the coils of line that he could not see.
paragraph.target: 彼は見えない糸の巻きを足で感じられるところまで戻った。

paragraph.source: There was plenty of line still and now the fish had to pull the friction of all that new line through the water.
paragraph.target: まだたっぷりと糸は残っていて、今や魚はその新しい糸の摩擦を水中で引きずらなければならなかった。

paragraph.source: Yes, he thought.
paragraph.target: そうだ、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: And now he has jumped more than a dozen times and filled the sacks along his back with air and he cannot go down deep to die where I cannot bring him up.
paragraph.target: そして今や彼は十数回も跳ねて背中の袋に空気を満たし、私が引き上げられない深みへは潜れなくなっている。

paragraph.source: He will start circling soon and then I must work on him.
paragraph.target: 彼はすぐに回り始めるだろう、そうなれば私は仕掛けなければならない。

paragraph.source: I wonder what started him so suddenly?
paragraph.target: 何が彼をあんなに突然動かしたのだろうか？

paragraph.source: Could it have been hunger that made him desperate, or was he frightened by something in the night?
paragraph.target: 飢えで必死になったのか、それとも夜の何かに怯えたのか？

paragraph.source: Maybe he suddenly felt fear.
paragraph.target: もしかすると突然恐怖を感じたのかもしれない。

paragraph.source: But he was such a calm, strong fish and he seemed so fearless and so confident.
paragraph.target: しかし彼はとても落ち着いていて強い魚で、恐れを知らず自信に満ちているように見えた。

paragraph.source: It is strange.
paragraph.target: 不思議なことだ。

paragraph.source: “You better be fearless and confident yourself, old man,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「おまえも恐れず自信を持てよ、老人。」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “You're holding him again but you cannot get line.
paragraph.target: 「また彼をつかんでいるが、糸は出せていない。

paragraph.source: But soon he has to circle.”
paragraph.target: でもすぐに彼は回り始めるはずだ。」

paragraph.source: The old man held him with his left hand and his shoulders now and stooped down and scooped up water in his right hand to get the crushed dolphin flesh off of his face.
paragraph.target: 老人は左手と肩で魚を支え、かがんで右手ですくった水で、魚の顔についた押しつぶされたイルカの肉を洗い落とした。

paragraph.source: He was afraid that it might nauseate him and he would vomit and lose his strength.
paragraph.target: 彼はそれが気持ち悪くなって吐き、力を失うのではないかと恐れていた。

paragraph.source: When his face was cleaned he washed his right hand in the water over the side and then let it stay in the salt water while he watched the first light come before the sunrise.
paragraph.target: 顔をきれいにすると、右手を船の側面の水で洗い、そのまま塩水に浸しておきながら、夜明け前の最初の光が差すのを見つめた。

paragraph.source: He's headed almost east, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼はほぼ東に向かっている、と老人は思った。

paragraph.source: That means he is tired and going with the current.
paragraph.target: それは彼が疲れていて、潮の流れに乗っているということだ。

paragraph.source: Soon he will have to circle.
paragraph.target: まもなく彼は回り始めるだろう。

paragraph.source: Then our true work begins.
paragraph.target: そうなれば、いよいよ本当の仕事が始まるのだ。

paragraph.source: After he judged that his right hand had been in the water long enough he took it out and looked at it.
paragraph.target: 右手が十分に水に浸かっていると判断すると、彼はそれを水から出して見つめた。

paragraph.source: “It is not bad,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「悪くない」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “And pain does not matter to a man.”
paragraph.target: 「そして痛みは男にとって問題ではない。」

paragraph.source: He took hold of the line carefully so that it did not fit into any of the fresh line cuts and shifted his weight so that he could put his left hand into the sea on the other side of the skiff.
paragraph.target: 彼は新しい釣り糸の切れ目にかからないように注意深く糸をつかんだ、そして体重を移して、小舟の反対側の海に左手を入れられるようにした。

paragraph.source: “You did not do so badly for something worthless,” he said to his left hand.
paragraph.target: 「役に立たないものにしては、よくやったよ」と彼は左手に言った。

paragraph.source: “But there was a moment when I could not find you.”
paragraph.target: 「でも、おまえを見失った瞬間があった。」

paragraph.source: Why was I not born with two good hands?
paragraph.target: なぜ私は両手がちゃんとした手で生まれなかったのだろう？

paragraph.source: he thought.
paragraph.target: と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Perhaps it was my fault in not training that one properly.
paragraph.target: たぶん、あの手をちゃんと鍛えなかったのは自分のせいだ。

paragraph.source: But God knows he has had enough chances to learn.
paragraph.target: しかし神は知っている、あの手は学ぶ機会を十分に与えられてきたことを。

paragraph.source: He did not do so badly in the night, though, and he has only cramped once.
paragraph.target: それでも夜の間はあまり悪くなかったし、一度しかつっていない。

paragraph.source: If he cramps again let the line cut him off.
paragraph.target: もしまたつるなら、糸に切られてしまえ。

paragraph.source: When he thought that he knew that he was not being clear-headed and he thought he should chew some more of the dolphin.
paragraph.target: そう考えたとき、彼は自分が冷静ではないことを自覚し、もっとイルカを噛んだほうがいいと思った。

paragraph.source: But I can't, he told himself.
paragraph.target: しかし、できないと彼は自分に言い聞かせた。

paragraph.source: It is better to be light-headed than to lose your strength from nausea.
paragraph.target: 吐き気で力を失うよりは、頭がぼんやりしているほうがましだ。

paragraph.source: And I know I cannot keep it if I eat it since my face was in it.
paragraph.target: それに、顔をつけたままだから食べても持たないこともわかっている。

paragraph.source: I will keep it for an emergency until it goes bad.
paragraph.target: 悪くなるまで非常時のために取っておくつもりだ。

paragraph.source: But it is too late to try for strength now through nourishment.
paragraph.target: だが、今さら栄養で力をつけようとしても遅すぎる。

paragraph.source: You're stupid, he told himself.
paragraph.target: ばかだなと彼は自分に言った。

paragraph.source: Eat the other flying fish.
paragraph.target: もう一匹のトビウオを食べろ。

paragraph.source: It was there, cleaned and ready, and he picked it up with his left hand and ate it chewing the bones carefully and eating all of it down to the tail.
paragraph.target: それはそこにあり、きれいに処理されて準備ができていた。彼は左手でそれを拾い上げ、骨を注意深く噛みながら尾まで全部食べた。

paragraph.source: It has more nourishment than almost any fish, he thought.
paragraph.target: ほとんどどの魚よりも栄養があると思った。

paragraph.source: At least the kind of strength that I need.
paragraph.target: 少なくとも、私が必要とする力の種類の栄養はある。

paragraph.source: Now I have done what I can, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今、できることはやったと思った。

paragraph.source: Let him begin to circle and let the fight come.
paragraph.target: さあ、魚が回り始めて戦いが始まるがいい。

paragraph.source: The sun was rising for the third time since he had put to sea when the fish started to circle.
paragraph.target: 魚が回り始めたとき、彼が海に出てから三度目の日の出が昇っていた。

paragraph.source: He could not see by the slant of the line that the fish was circling.
paragraph.target: 彼は糸の傾きから魚が回っているのを見分けることができなかった。

paragraph.source: It was too early for that.
paragraph.target: それはまだ早すぎた。

paragraph.source: He just felt a faint slackening of the pressure of the line and he commenced to pull on it gently with his right hand.
paragraph.target: 彼はただ糸の張りがわずかに緩むのを感じて、右手でそっと引き始めた。

paragraph.source: It tightened, as always, but just when he reached the point where it would break, line began to come in.
paragraph.target: いつものように糸は張りつめたが、切れそうなところまで来たときに、糸が巻き取られ始めた。

paragraph.source: He slipped his shoulders and head from under the line and began to pull in line steadily and gently.
paragraph.target: 彼は肩と頭を糸の下から抜いて、糸をゆっくりと一定の力で引き始めた。

paragraph.source: He used both of his hands in a swinging motion and tried to do the pulling as much as he could with his body and his legs.
paragraph.target: 彼は両手を使って振り子のように動かし、できるだけ体と脚の力も使って引こうとした。

paragraph.source: His old legs and shoulders pivoted with the swinging of the pulling.
paragraph.target: 彼の老いた脚と肩は引く動きに合わせて回転した。

paragraph.source: “It is a very big circle,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「とても大きな円だ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “But he is circling.”
paragraph.target: 「だが、魚は回っている。」

paragraph.source: Then the line would not come in any more and he held it until he saw the drops jumping from it in the sun.
paragraph.target: それから糸はもう引けなくなり、彼は日差しの中で糸から水滴が跳ねるのを見届けるまでそれを握り続けた。

paragraph.source: Then it started out and the old man knelt down and let it go grudgingly back into the dark water.
paragraph.target: そして糸はまた出ていき、老人はひざまずいて、しぶしぶそれを暗い水の中へ戻した。

paragraph.source: “He is making the far part of his circle now,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「今、彼は円の遠い部分を回っている」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: I must hold all I can, he thought.
paragraph.target: できるだけ強く引かなければ、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: The strain will shorten his circle each time.
paragraph.target: その張りは毎回、彼の円を短くするだろう。

paragraph.source: Perhaps in an hour I will see him.
paragraph.target: おそらく一時間後には彼を見ることができるだろう。

paragraph.source: Now I must convince him and then I must kill him.
paragraph.target: 今は彼を納得させなければならない、そしてその後に殺さなければならない。

paragraph.source: But the fish kept on circling slowly and the old man was wet with sweat and tired deep into his bones two hours later.
paragraph.target: しかし魚はゆっくりと円を描き続け、老人は二時間後には汗でびっしょりと濡れ、骨の髄まで疲れていた。

paragraph.source: But the circles were much shorter now and from the way the line slanted he could tell the fish had risen steadily while he swam.
paragraph.target: しかしその円はずっと小さくなっており、糸の傾き方から魚が泳ぎながら着実に浮上していることがわかった。

paragraph.source: For an hour the old man had been seeing black spots before his eyes and the sweat salted his eyes and salted the cut over his eye and on his forehead.
paragraph.target: 老人は一時間の間、目の前に黒い点が見え、汗が目にしみ、目の上の傷や額にも塩のようにしみていた。

paragraph.source: He was not afraid of the black spots.
paragraph.target: 彼はその黒い点を恐れてはいなかった。

paragraph.source: They were normal at the tension that he was pulling on the line.
paragraph.target: それは、彼が糸にかけている張りの強さでは普通のことだった。

paragraph.source: Twice, though, he had felt faint and dizzy and that had worried him.
paragraph.target: しかし二度、彼はめまいと気分の悪さを感じ、それが彼を心配させた。

paragraph.source: “I could not fail myself and die on a fish like this,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「こんな魚に負けて自分を裏切り、死ぬわけにはいかない」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Now that I have him coming so beautifully, God help me endure.
paragraph.target: 「今や魚は見事にこちらに向かっている。神よ、どうか耐えさせてください。

paragraph.source: I'll say a hundred Our Fathers and a hundred Hail Marys.
paragraph.target: 主の祈りを百回、アヴェ・マリアを百回唱えよう。

paragraph.source: But I cannot say them now.”
paragraph.target: だが今はそれを唱えることはできない。」

paragraph.source: Consider them said, he thought.
paragraph.target: それらは言い終えたものと考えよう、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: I'll say them later.
paragraph.target: 後で言おう。

paragraph.source: Just then he felt a sudden banging and jerking on the line he held with his two hands.
paragraph.target: ちょうどその時、彼は両手で握っている釣り糸に突然の強い衝撃と揺れを感じた。

paragraph.source: It was sharp and hard-feeling and heavy.
paragraph.target: それは鋭く、硬く、そして重々しい感触だった。

paragraph.source: He is hitting the wire leader with his spear, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は槍で釣り糸のワイヤーリーダーを叩いているのだと、彼は思った。

paragraph.source: That was bound to come.
paragraph.target: それは必ず起こることだった。

paragraph.source: He had to do that.
paragraph.target: 彼はそうしなければならなかったのだ。

paragraph.source: It may make him jump though and I would rather he stayed circling now.
paragraph.target: だがそれで魚が跳ねるかもしれない。今は魚が回り続けていてほしいのだが。

paragraph.source: The jumps were necessary for him to take air.
paragraph.target: 跳ねることは魚が空気を吸うために必要だった。

paragraph.source: But after that each one can widen the opening of the hook wound and he can throw the hook.
paragraph.target: しかしその後は、跳ねるたびに釣り針の傷口が広がり、魚は針を外すことができる。

paragraph.source: “Don't jump, fish,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「跳ぶな、魚よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Don't jump.”
paragraph.target: 「跳ぶな」

paragraph.source: The fish hit the wire several times more and each time he shook his head the old man gave up a little line.
paragraph.target: 魚はさらに何度かワイヤーを叩き、頭を振るたびに老人は少しずつ糸を緩めた。

paragraph.source: I must hold his pain where it is, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼の痛みはそのままにしておかなければならない、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Mine does not matter.
paragraph.target: 自分の痛みは問題ではない。

paragraph.source: I can control mine.
paragraph.target: 自分の痛みは自分で抑えられる。

paragraph.source: But his pain could drive him mad.
paragraph.target: しかし彼の痛みは彼を狂わせるかもしれない。

paragraph.source: After a while the fish stopped beating at the wire and started circling slowly again.
paragraph.target: しばらくして魚はワイヤーを叩くのをやめ、またゆっくりと回り始めた。

paragraph.source: The old man was gaining line steadily now.
paragraph.target: 老人は今や着実に糸を巻き取っていた。

paragraph.source: But he felt faint again.
paragraph.target: しかし彼は再びめまいを感じた。

paragraph.source: He lifted some sea water with his left hand and put it on his head.
paragraph.target: 彼は左手で海水をすくい、それを頭にかけた。

paragraph.source: Then he put more on and rubbed the back of his neck.
paragraph.target: それからさらに海水をかけて、首の後ろを擦った。

paragraph.source: “I have no cramps,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「こむら返りはない」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “He'll be up soon and I can last.
paragraph.target: 「魚はすぐに浮かび上がってくるし、俺は持ちこたえられる。

paragraph.source: You have to last.
paragraph.target: お前は耐えなければならない。

paragraph.source: Don't even speak of it.”
paragraph.target: そんなことは口にするな。」

paragraph.source: He kneeled against the bow and, for a moment, slipped the line over his back again.
paragraph.target: 彼は船首にひざまずき、しばらくの間、再び釣り糸を背中に回した。

paragraph.source: I'll rest now while he goes out on the circle and then stand up and work on him when he comes in, he decided.
paragraph.target: 魚が円を描いて遠くに行っている間に休み、戻ってきたら立ち上がって仕掛けを引こうと彼は決めた。

paragraph.source: It was a great temptation to rest in the bow and let the fish make one circle by himself without recovering any line.
paragraph.target: 船首で休んで、魚が自分で一周している間に釣り糸を巻き取らずにいるのは大きな誘惑だった。

paragraph.source: But when the strain showed the fish had turned to come toward the boat, the old man rose to his feet and started the pivoting and the weaving pulling that brought in all the line he gained.
paragraph.target: しかし、魚が船に向かって戻ってきたことを示す張りが現れると、老人は立ち上がり、得た釣り糸をすべて巻き取るために体を回しながら引く動作を始めた。

paragraph.source: I'm tireder than I have ever been, he thought, and now the trade wind is rising.
paragraph.target: これまでにないほど疲れている、と彼は思った。そして今、貿易風が強くなってきている。

paragraph.source: But that will be good to take him in with.
paragraph.target: しかし、それは魚を引き寄せるのに都合がいいだろう。

paragraph.source: I need that badly.
paragraph.target: それがどうしても必要だ。

paragraph.source: “I'll rest on the next turn as he goes out,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「次の回転で魚が外に行くときに休もう」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “I feel much better.
paragraph.target: 「ずっと楽になった。

paragraph.source: Then in two or three turns more I will have him.”
paragraph.target: それからあと二、三回の回転で捕まえるつもりだ。」

paragraph.source: His straw hat was far on the back of his head and he sank down into the bow with the pull of the line as he felt the fish turn.
paragraph.target: 彼の麦わら帽子は頭のずっと後ろにずれていた、そして魚が向きを変えたのを感じて、釣り糸の引きに合わせて船首に身を沈めた。

paragraph.source: You work now, fish, he thought.
paragraph.target: 「さあ働け、魚よ」と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: I'll take you at the turn.
paragraph.target: 曲がるときにお前を捕まえるつもりだ。

paragraph.source: The sea had risen considerably.
paragraph.target: 海はかなり高くなっていた。

paragraph.source: But it was a fair-weather breeze and he had to have it to get home.
paragraph.target: しかし、それは良い天気の風であり、彼はそれを利用して帰らなければならなかった。

paragraph.source: “I'll just steer south and west,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「ただ南と西に舵を取るだけだ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “A man is never lost at sea and it is a long island.”
paragraph.target: 「海で人は決して迷わないし、あの島は長いからな。」

paragraph.source: It was on the third turn that he saw the fish first.
paragraph.target: 魚を最初に見たのは三度目の回転のときだった。

paragraph.source: He saw him first as a dark shadow that took so long to pass under the boat that he could not believe its length.
paragraph.target: 彼は最初に、船の下を通るのにあまりにも長い時間がかかる暗い影としてそれを見たので、その長さを信じられなかった。

paragraph.source: “No,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「いや」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “He can't be that big.”
paragraph.target: 「あんなに大きいはずがない。」

paragraph.source: But he was that big and at the end of this circle he came to the surface only thirty yards away and the man saw his tail out of water.
paragraph.target: しかし、魚はその大きさであり、この円の終わりで彼はわずか三十ヤード先の水面に姿を現し、老人は水から出た尾を見た。

paragraph.source: It was higher than a big scythe blade and a very pale lavender above the dark blue water.
paragraph.target: それは大きな鎌の刃よりも高く、濃い青い水の上に非常に淡い藤色をしていた。

paragraph.source: It raked back and as the fish swam just below the surface the old man could see his huge bulk and the purple stripes that banded him.
paragraph.target: それは後方にかしげており、魚が水面すれすれを泳ぐにつれて、老人はその巨大な体躯と紫色の縞模様を見て取ることができた。

paragraph.source: His dorsal fin was down and his huge pectorals were spread wide.
paragraph.target: 背びれは伏せられ、巨大な胸びれは大きく広げられていた。

paragraph.source: On this circle the old man could see the fish's eye and the two gray sucking fish that swam around him.
paragraph.target: この円を描く動きの中で、老人は魚の目と、その周りを泳ぐ二匹の灰色の吸盤魚を見ることができた。

paragraph.source: Sometimes they attached themselves to him.
paragraph.target: 時には彼らは魚にくっついた。

paragraph.source: Sometimes they darted off.
paragraph.target: 時にはすっと離れていった。

paragraph.source: Sometimes they would swim easily in his shadow.
paragraph.target: 時には魚の影の中を楽に泳いでいた。

paragraph.source: They were each over three feet long and when they swam fast they lashed their whole bodies like eels.
paragraph.target: それぞれ三フィート以上の長さがあり、速く泳ぐときはウナギのように全身をしなやかに動かしていた。

paragraph.source: The old man was sweating now but from something else besides the sun.
paragraph.target: 老人は今や汗をかいていたが、それは太陽のせいだけではなかった。

paragraph.source: On each calm placid turn the fish made he was gaining line and he was sure that in two turns more he would have a chance to get the harpoon in.
paragraph.target: 魚が穏やかで静かな旋回をするたびに、彼は糸を巻き取り、あと二回の旋回で銛を打ち込むチャンスがあると確信していた。

paragraph.source: But I must get him close, close, close, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、私は彼を近く、近く、もっと近くに引き寄せなければならない、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: I mustn't try for the head.
paragraph.target: 頭を狙ってはいけない。

paragraph.source: I must get the heart.
paragraph.target: 心臓を狙わなければならない。

paragraph.source: “Be calm and strong, old man,”
paragraph.target: 「落ち着いて強くあれ、老人よ」と

paragraph.source: he said.
paragraph.target: 彼は言った。

paragraph.source: On the next circle the fish's back was out but he was a little too far from the boat.
paragraph.target: 次の円を描くとき、魚の背中が水面に出ていたが、船からは少し離れすぎていた。

paragraph.source: On the next circle he was still too far away but he was higher out of water and the old man was sure that by gaining some more line he could have him alongside.
paragraph.target: 次の円でもまだ遠すぎたが、魚は水面からより高く出ており、老人はあと少し糸を巻き取れば魚を船のそばに寄せられると確信していた。

paragraph.source: He had rigged his harpoon long before and its coil of light rope was in a round basket and the end was made fast to the bitt in the bow.
paragraph.target: 彼はずっと前に銛を仕掛けていた、そしてその軽い縄の巻きは丸いかごの中にあった、縄の端は船首のビットにしっかりと結びつけられていた。

paragraph.source: The fish was coming in on his circle now calm and beautiful looking and only his great tail moving.
paragraph.target: 魚は今、円を描きながら近づいてきていた。落ち着いて美しく見え、動いているのは大きな尾だけだった。

paragraph.source: The old man pulled on him all that he could to bring him closer.
paragraph.target: 老人は魚をもっと近づけようと、できる限り強く引いた。

paragraph.source: For just a moment the fish turned a little on his side.
paragraph.target: ほんの一瞬、魚は少し横を向いた。

paragraph.source: Then he straightened himself and began another circle.
paragraph.target: それから魚は体をまっすぐに戻し、また一周し始めた。

paragraph.source: “I moved him,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「動かしたぞ」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: “I moved him then.”
paragraph.target: 「今、動かしたんだ」

paragraph.source: He felt faint again now but he held on the great fish all the strain that he could.
paragraph.target: 彼は再び気が遠くなりそうだったが、それでもできる限りの力で大魚をしっかりとつかんでいた。

paragraph.source: I moved him, he thought.
paragraph.target: 『動かしたぞ』と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Maybe this time I can get him over.
paragraph.target: 今度こそ引き寄せられるかもしれない。

paragraph.source: Pull, hands, he thought.
paragraph.target: 『引け、手よ』と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Hold up, legs.
paragraph.target: 『踏ん張れ、脚よ』。

paragraph.source: Last for me, head.
paragraph.target: 『もってくれ、頭よ』。

paragraph.source: Last for me.
paragraph.target: 『もってくれ』。

paragraph.source: You never went.
paragraph.target: 『おまえは決して諦めなかった』。

paragraph.source: This time I'll pull him over.
paragraph.target: 今度こそ引き寄せてやる。

paragraph.source: But when he put all of his effort on, starting it well out before the fish came alongside and pulling with all his strength, the fish pulled part way over and then righted himself and swam away.
paragraph.target: しかし、魚が船のそばに来るずっと前から全力を込めて糸を引き始め、全力で引っ張ったとき、魚は途中まで引き寄せられたが、体勢を立て直して泳ぎ去った。

paragraph.source: “Fish,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「魚よ」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: “Fish, you are going to have to die anyway.
paragraph.target: 「魚よ、おまえはどうせ死ななければならないのだ。

paragraph.source: Do you have to kill me too?”
paragraph.target: おまえはなぜ私も殺さなければならないのか？」

paragraph.source: That way nothing is accomplished, he thought.
paragraph.target: そうしていても何も成し遂げられない、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: His mouth was too dry to speak but he could not reach for the water now.
paragraph.target: 口は乾きすぎて話すこともできなかったが、今は水に手を伸ばすこともできなかった。

paragraph.source: I must get him alongside this time, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今度こそ魚を船のそばに引き寄せなければならない、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: I am not good for many more turns.
paragraph.target: もう何度も体を動かせそうにない。

paragraph.source: Yes you are, he told himself.
paragraph.target: いや、まだできると彼は自分に言い聞かせた。

paragraph.source: You're good for ever.
paragraph.target: おまえはまだまだやれるのだ。

paragraph.source: On the next turn, he nearly had him.
paragraph.target: 次の一回転で、彼はほとんど魚を捕らえかけた。

paragraph.source: But again the fish righted himself and swam slowly away.
paragraph.target: しかしまた魚は体勢を立て直し、ゆっくりと泳ぎ去った。

paragraph.source: You are killing me, fish, the old man thought.
paragraph.target: おまえは俺を殺している、魚よ、と老人は思った。

paragraph.source: But you have a right to.
paragraph.target: だが、おまえにはその権利がある。

paragraph.source: Never have I seen a greater, or more beautiful, or a calmer or more noble thing than you, brother.
paragraph.target: おまえほど偉大で、美しく、落ち着いていて、気高いものを見たことがない、兄弟よ。

paragraph.source: Come on and kill me.
paragraph.target: さあ、かかってこい、そして俺を殺せ。

paragraph.source: I do not care who kills who.
paragraph.target: 誰が誰を殺すかなんて気にしない。

paragraph.source: Now you are getting confused in the head, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今、おまえは頭が混乱している、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: You must keep your head clear.
paragraph.target: 頭をはっきりさせていなければならない。

paragraph.source: Keep your head clear and know how to suffer like a man.
paragraph.target: 頭をはっきりさせて、人間のように耐えることを知れ。

paragraph.source: Or a fish, he thought.
paragraph.target: あるいは魚のように、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: “Clear up, head,” he said in a voice he could hardly hear.
paragraph.target: 「頭をはっきりさせろ」と、ほとんど聞こえない声で彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Clear up.”
paragraph.target: 「はっきりさせろ。」

paragraph.source: Twice more it was the same on the turns.
paragraph.target: 二度続けて、向きを変えたときも同じだった。

paragraph.source: I do not know, the old man thought.
paragraph.target: わからない、と老人は思った。

paragraph.source: He had been on the point of feeling himself go each time.
paragraph.target: 彼はそのたびに自分が限界に達しそうになっていた。

paragraph.source: I do not know.
paragraph.target: わからない。

paragraph.source: But I will try it once more.
paragraph.target: だがもう一度やってみよう。

paragraph.source: He tried it once more and he felt himself going when he turned the fish.
paragraph.target: 彼はもう一度試みたが、魚の向きを変えたときに自分が限界に達しそうだと感じた。

paragraph.source: The fish righted himself and swam off again slowly with the great tail weaving in the air.
paragraph.target: 魚は体勢を立て直し、大きな尾を空中で揺らしながらゆっくりと再び泳ぎ去った。

paragraph.source: I'll try it again, the old man promised, although his hands were mushy now and he could only see well in flashes.
paragraph.target: もう一度やってみると、老人は約束した。今や手はぐにゃぐにゃで、ちらちらとしかよく見えなかったが。

paragraph.source: He tried it again and it was the same.
paragraph.target: 彼はもう一度試したが、同じだった。

paragraph.source: So, he thought, and he felt himself going before he started;
paragraph.target: そう思い、始める前に自分が限界に達しそうだと感じたが、

paragraph.source: I will try it once again.
paragraph.target: もう一度やってみようと決めた。

paragraph.source: He took all his pain and what was left of his strength and his long gone pride and he put it against the fish's agony and the fish came over onto his side and swam gently on his side, his bill almost touching the planking of the skiff and started to pass the boat, long, deep, wide, silver and barred with purple and interminable in the water.
paragraph.target: 彼は自分のすべての痛みと残り少ない力、そしてずっと前に失った誇りをすべて集めて、魚の苦しみにぶつけた、すると魚は横向きになり、そっと横たわって泳ぎ始めた。そのくちばしは小舟の板張りにほとんど触れそうだった、そして船を通り過ぎ始めた。長く、深く、幅広く、銀色で紫の縞模様があり、水中で果てしなく続いているようだった。

paragraph.source: The old man dropped the line and put his foot on it and lifted the harpoon as high as he could and drove it down with all his strength, and more strength he had just summoned, into the fish's side just behind the great chest fin that rose high in the air to the altitude of the man's chest.
paragraph.target: 老人は釣り糸を手放し、足で押さえ、銛をできるだけ高く持ち上げて、全力で突き刺した。そして、今まさに呼び起こしたさらなる力を込めて、魚の側面に突き立てた。その場所は、老人の胸の高さまで空にそびえる大きな胸びれのすぐ後ろだった。

paragraph.source: He felt the iron go in and he leaned on it and drove it further and then pushed all his weight after it.
paragraph.target: 鉄の先が刺さるのを感じると、彼はそれに体重をかけてさらに突き進め、最後には全体重をかけて押し込んだ。

paragraph.source: Then the fish came alive, with his death in him, and rose high out of the water showing all his great length and width and all his power and his beauty.
paragraph.target: すると魚は死を内に秘めながらも生き返ったかのように、水面から高く跳ね上がり、その大きな長さと幅、そして力強さと美しさのすべてを見せた。

paragraph.source: He seemed to hang in the air above the old man in the skiff.
paragraph.target: 魚は小舟の上の老人の頭上で空中に止まっているかのように見えた。

paragraph.source: Then he fell into the water with a crash that sent spray over the old man and over all of the skiff.
paragraph.target: そして魚は激しく水面に落ち、そのはねた水しぶきが老人と小舟全体にかかった。

paragraph.source: The old man felt faint and sick and he could not see well.
paragraph.target: 老人はめまいと吐き気を感じ、よく見えなかった。

paragraph.source: But he cleared the harpoon line and let it run slowly through his raw hands and, when he could see, he saw the fish was on his back with his silver belly up.
paragraph.target: しかし彼は銛の縄を整理し、擦りむけた手の間をゆっくりと滑らせた。見えるようになると、魚は背中を上にして銀色の腹を見せていた。

paragraph.source: The shaft of the harpoon was projecting at an angle from the fish's shoulder and the sea was discolouring with the red of the blood from his heart.
paragraph.target: 銛の柄は魚の肩から斜めに突き出ており、海は魚の心臓から流れ出る血の赤で色を変えていた。

paragraph.source: First it was dark as a shoal in the blue water that was more than a mile deep.
paragraph.target: 最初は、深さ一マイル以上ある青い海の中の魚群のように暗かった。

paragraph.source: Then it spread like a cloud.
paragraph.target: それから血は雲のように広がっていった。

paragraph.source: The fish was silvery and still and floated with the waves.
paragraph.target: 魚は銀色で静かに波に漂っていた。

paragraph.source: The old man looked carefully in the glimpse of vision that he had.
paragraph.target: 老人はかろうじて見える視界の中で注意深く見つめた。

paragraph.source: Then he took two turns of the harpoon line around the bitt in the bow and laid his head on his hands.
paragraph.target: それから彼は銛の縄を船首のビットに二巻きし、手の上に頭をのせた。

paragraph.source: “Keep my head clear,” he said against the wood of the bow.
paragraph.target: 「頭をはっきりさせろ」と彼は船首の木に向かって言った。

paragraph.source: “I am a tired old man.
paragraph.target: 「私は疲れ果てた老人だ。

paragraph.source: But I have killed this fish which is my brother and now I must do the slave work.”
paragraph.target: しかし、この魚は私の兄弟であり、私はそれを仕留めた。今は奴隷のような仕事をしなければならない。」

paragraph.source: Now I must prepare the nooses and the rope to lash him alongside, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今、彼を横付けに縛りつけるための縄と綱を準備しなければならない、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: Even if we were two and swamped her to load him and bailed her out, this skiff would never hold him.
paragraph.target: たとえ二人で彼を積むために小舟を沈めてくみ出したとしても、この小舟は決して彼を支えきれないだろう。

paragraph.source: I must prepare everything, then bring him in and lash him well and step the mast and set sail for home.
paragraph.target: すべてを準備してから彼を引き寄せ、しっかりと縛り、帆柱を立てて家路につかなければならない。

paragraph.source: He started to pull the fish in to have him alongside so that he could pass a line through his gills and out his mouth and make his head fast alongside the bow.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚を引き寄せて横に並べ始めた。そうすれば、えらを通して口から縄を通し、魚の頭を船首の横にしっかり固定できるからだ。

paragraph.source: I want to see him, he thought, and to touch and to feel him.
paragraph.target: 「彼を見たい」と彼は思った。そして触れて、感じたいとも思った。

paragraph.source: He is my fortune, he thought.
paragraph.target: 「彼は私の幸運だ」と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: But that is not why I wish to feel him.
paragraph.target: しかし、それが私が彼を感じたい理由ではない。

paragraph.source: I think I felt his heart, he thought.
paragraph.target: 「私は彼の心臓を感じたのだと思う」と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: When I pushed on the harpoon shaft the second time.
paragraph.target: 二度目に銛の柄を押したときに。

paragraph.source: Bring him in now and make him fast and get the noose around his tail and another around his middle to bind him to the skiff.
paragraph.target: 今すぐ彼を引き寄せて固定し、尾に輪をかけ、胴のあたりにももう一つ輪をかけて小舟に縛りつけなければならない。

paragraph.source: “Get to work, old man,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「働けよ、老人」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: He took a very small drink of the water.
paragraph.target: 彼はほんの少しだけ水を飲んだ。

paragraph.source: “There is very much slave work to be done now that the fight is over.”
paragraph.target: 「戦いが終わった今、やらなければならない奴隷のような仕事がたくさんあるのだ。」

paragraph.source: He looked up at the sky and then out to his fish.
paragraph.target: 彼は空を見上げ、それから自分の魚の方を見た。

paragraph.source: He looked at the sun carefully.
paragraph.target: 彼は太陽を注意深く見た。

paragraph.source: It is not much more than noon, he thought.
paragraph.target: 正午を少し過ぎたばかりだと思った。

paragraph.source: And the trade wind is rising.
paragraph.target: そして貿易風が吹き始めている。

paragraph.source: The lines all mean nothing now.
paragraph.target: もはや釣り糸は何の意味も持たない。

paragraph.source: The boy and I will splice them when we are home.
paragraph.target: 少年と私は家に帰ったらそれらをつなぎ直すだろう。

paragraph.source: “Come on, fish,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「さあ、魚よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: But the fish did not come.
paragraph.target: しかし魚は来なかった。

paragraph.source: Instead he lay there wallowing now in the seas and the old man pulled the skiff up onto him.
paragraph.target: 代わりに魚は海の中でのたうち回っていたので、老人は小舟を引き寄せて魚の上に乗せた。

paragraph.source: When he was even with him and had the fish's head against the bow he could not believe his size.
paragraph.target: 彼が魚と並び、魚の頭を船首に押し当てたとき、その大きさを信じられなかった。

paragraph.source: But he untied the harpoon rope from the bitt, passed it through the fish's gills and out his jaws, made a turn around his sword then passed the rope through the other gill, made another turn around the bill and knotted the double rope and made it fast to the bitt in the bow.
paragraph.target: しかし彼は銛の縄をビットから解き、魚のえらを通して顎の外へ通し、剣の周りで一巻きし、さらに反対側のえらを通してもう一巻きし、二重の縄を結び、船首のビットにしっかりと結びつけた。

paragraph.source: He cut the rope then and went astern to noose the tail.
paragraph.target: それから縄を切り、船尾へ回って尾を輪で縛ろうとした。

paragraph.source: The fish had turned silver from his original purple and silver, and the stripes showed the same pale violet colour as his tail.
paragraph.target: 魚はもとの紫と銀色から銀色に変わり、縞模様は尾と同じ淡い紫色を帯びていた。

paragraph.source: They were wider than a man's hand with his fingers spread and the fish's eye looked as detached as the mirrors in a periscope or as a saint in a procession.
paragraph.target: それらは指を広げた人の手よりも幅広く、魚の目は潜望鏡の鏡のように無感情で、行列の聖人のように遠く離れて見えた。

paragraph.source: “It was the only way to kill him,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「それが彼を殺す唯一の方法だった」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: He was feeling better since the water and he knew he would not go away and his head was clear.
paragraph.target: 水に入ってから気分が良くなり、魚は逃げないとわかり、頭もすっきりしていた。

paragraph.source: He's over fifteen hundred pounds the way he is, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は今のままで千五百ポンドを超えている、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Maybe much more.
paragraph.target: おそらくそれ以上だ。

paragraph.source: If he dresses out two-thirds of that at thirty cents a pound?
paragraph.target: もしその三分の二をさばいて一ポンド三十セントなら？

paragraph.source: “I need a pencil for that,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「それには鉛筆が必要だ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “My head is not that clear.
paragraph.target: 「頭がそれほど冴えていないからね。

paragraph.source: But I think the great DiMaggio would be proud of me today.
paragraph.target: でも、偉大なディマジオなら今日の俺を誇りに思うだろう。」

paragraph.source: I had no bone spurs.
paragraph.target: 「骨棘（こつきょく）はなかった。」

paragraph.source: But the hands and the back hurt truly.”
paragraph.target: 「だが、手と背中は本当に痛む。」

paragraph.source: I wonder what a bone spur is, he thought.
paragraph.target: 骨棘って何だろう、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Maybe we have them without knowing of it.
paragraph.target: 知らずに持っているのかもしれないな。

paragraph.source: He made the fish fast to bow and stern and to the middle thwart.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚を船首と船尾、そして中央の横木にしっかりと縛りつけた。

paragraph.source: He was so big it was like lashing a much bigger skiff alongside.
paragraph.target: 魚はあまりに大きく、まるではるかに大きな小舟を横に縛りつけるようだった。

paragraph.source: He cut a piece of line and tied the fish's lower jaw against his bill so his mouth would not open and they would sail as cleanly as possible.
paragraph.target: 彼はロープを切り取り、魚の下あごを船の先端に結びつけて口が開かないようにし、できるだけすっきりと帆走できるようにした。

paragraph.source: Then he stepped the mast and, with the stick that was his gaff and with his boom rigged, the patched sail drew, the boat began to move, and half lying in the stern he sailed south-west.
paragraph.target: それから彼はマストを立て、ガフ代わりの棒とブームを取り付けて、修繕した帆を張った。船は動き始め、彼は船尾に半ば横たわったまま南西へと帆走した。

paragraph.source: He did not need a compass to tell him where south-west was.
paragraph.target: 彼は南西がどちらかを知るのにコンパスを必要としなかった。

paragraph.source: He only needed the feel of the trade wind and the drawing of the sail.
paragraph.target: 彼に必要だったのは貿易風の感触と帆の引き具合だけだった。

paragraph.source: I better put a small line out with a spoon on it and try and get something to eat and drink for the moisture.
paragraph.target: 小さな糸にスプーンをつけて垂らし、何か食べるものと水分を取ろうと思った。

paragraph.source: But he could not find a spoon and his sardines were rotten.
paragraph.target: しかし彼はスプーンを見つけられず、イワシは腐っていた。

paragraph.source: So he hooked a patch of yellow gulf weed with the gaff as they passed and shook it so that the small shrimps that were in it fell onto the planking of the skiff.
paragraph.target: そこで彼は通りかかった黄色い湾藻の塊をガフで引っ掛け、揺すって中にいた小さなエビを小舟の甲板に落とした。

paragraph.source: There were more than a dozen of them and they jumped and kicked like sand fleas.
paragraph.target: それは十数匹いて、砂ノミのように跳ねてはね回った。

paragraph.source: The old man pinched their heads off with his thumb and forefinger and ate them chewing up the shells and the tails.
paragraph.target: 老人は親指と人差し指で頭をつまんで取ると、殻や尾も噛み砕いて食べた。

paragraph.source: They were very tiny but he knew they were nourishing and they tasted good.
paragraph.target: それらはとても小さかったが、栄養があり味も良いことを彼は知っていた。

paragraph.source: The old man still had two drinks of water in the bottle and he used half of one after he had eaten the shrimps.
paragraph.target: 老人はまだ瓶の中に水を二口分残していて、エビを食べた後にそのうちの半分を飲んだ。

paragraph.source: The skiff was sailing well considering the handicaps and he steered with the tiller under his arm.
paragraph.target: 小舟は不利な状況を考えればよく帆走していて、彼は舵棒を脇に挟んで操舵していた。

paragraph.source: He could see the fish and he had only to look at his hands and feel his back against the stern to know that this had truly happened and was not a dream.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚を見ることができ、ただ自分の手を見て、背中が船尾に触れているのを感じるだけで、これは本当に起こったことで夢ではないとわかった。

paragraph.source: At one time when he was feeling so badly toward the end, he had thought perhaps it was a dream.
paragraph.target: 終わりに近づいて非常に具合が悪くなったとき、彼はこれが夢かもしれないと思ったことがあった。

paragraph.source: Then when he had seen the fish come out of the water and hang motionless in the sky before he fell, he was sure there was some great strangeness and he could not believe it.
paragraph.target: それから、魚が水面から飛び出して空中で動かずに止まっているのを見てから倒れたとき、彼は何か大きな異様さがあると確信し、信じられなかった。

paragraph.source: Then he could not see well, although now he saw as well as ever.
paragraph.target: そのときはよく見えなかったが、今はいつも通りよく見えている。

paragraph.source: Now he knew there was the fish and his hands and back were no dream.
paragraph.target: 今や彼は魚がいることを知っており、自分の手と背中が夢ではないこともわかっていた。

paragraph.source: The hands cure quickly, he thought.
paragraph.target: 手はすぐに治る、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: I bled them clean and the salt water will heal them.
paragraph.target: 血をきれいに流したし、塩水がそれを癒してくれるだろう。

paragraph.source: The dark water of the true gulf is the greatest healer that there is.
paragraph.target: 本当の湾の暗い水こそが、最も偉大な癒し手なのだ。

paragraph.source: All I must do is keep the head clear.
paragraph.target: 私がしなければならないのは、頭をはっきりさせておくことだけだ。

paragraph.source: The hands have done their work and we sail well.
paragraph.target: 手は仕事を終え、私たちは順調に進んでいる。

paragraph.source: With his mouth shut and his tail straight up and down we sail like brothers.
paragraph.target: 魚は口を閉じ、尾をまっすぐ上下にして、私たちは兄弟のように進んでいる。

paragraph.source: Then his head started to become a little unclear and he thought, is he bringing me in or am I bringing him in?
paragraph.target: すると彼の頭は少しぼんやりし始め、彼は考えた。魚が私を引き寄せているのか、それとも私が魚を引き寄せているのか？

paragraph.source: If I were towing him behind there would be no question.
paragraph.target: もし私が魚を後ろに引いているのなら、疑いはなかっただろう。

paragraph.source: Nor if the fish were in the skiff, with all dignity gone, there would be no question either.
paragraph.target: また、魚が小舟の中にいて、すべての威厳を失っているのなら、それも疑いようがなかっただろう。

paragraph.source: But they were sailing together lashed side by side and the old man thought, let him bring me in if it pleases him.
paragraph.target: しかし彼らは並んで縛られたまま一緒に進んでおり、老人は思った。魚が望むなら私を引き寄せさせてやろう、と。

paragraph.source: I am only better than him through trickery and he meant me no harm.
paragraph.target: 私はただずる賢さで彼よりましなだけで、魚は私に害を与えるつもりはなかったのだ。

paragraph.source: They sailed well and the old man soaked his hands in the salt water and tried to keep his head clear.
paragraph.target: 彼らは順調に進み、老人は手を塩水に浸しながら頭を冷静に保とうとした。

paragraph.source: There were high cumulus clouds and enough cirrus above them so that the old man knew the breeze would last all night.
paragraph.target: 高い積雲と十分な巻雲が空にあり、老人は風が一晩中続くことを知っていた。

paragraph.source: The old man looked at the fish constantly to make sure it was true.
paragraph.target: 老人はそれが本当であることを確かめるために、絶えず魚を見つめていた。

paragraph.source: It was an hour before the first shark hit him.
paragraph.target: 最初のサメが襲ってくるまでに一時間あった。

paragraph.source: The shark was not an accident.
paragraph.target: サメは偶然ではなかった。

paragraph.source: He had come up from deep down in the water as the dark cloud of blood had settled and dispersed in the mile deep sea.
paragraph.target: 彼は、血の暗い雲が沈み、深さ一マイルの海で散らばった後、水深の深いところから浮かび上がってきたのだ。

paragraph.source: He had come up so fast and absolutely without caution that he broke the surface of the blue water and was in the sun.
paragraph.target: 彼はあまりにも速く、まったく警戒心なく浮上したため、青い水面を破って太陽の光の中に出た。

paragraph.source: Then he fell back into the sea and picked up the scent and started swimming on the course the skiff and the fish had taken.
paragraph.target: それから彼は海に戻り、匂いを嗅ぎ取り、小舟と魚が進んだ方向に向かって泳ぎ始めた。

paragraph.source: Sometimes he lost the scent.
paragraph.target: 時々彼は匂いを見失った。

paragraph.source: But he would pick it up again, or have just a trace of it, and he swam fast and hard on the course.
paragraph.target: しかし彼はまた匂いを嗅ぎ分けるか、かすかな痕跡をたどり、小舟と魚の進路を速く力強く泳いだ。

paragraph.source: He was a very big Mako shark built to swim as fast as the fastest fish in the sea and everything about him was beautiful except his jaws.
paragraph.target: 彼は非常に大きなマカオザメで、海の中で最も速い魚と同じくらい速く泳ぐようにできており、顎以外はすべてが美しかった。

paragraph.source: His back was as blue as a sword fish's and his belly was silver and his hide was smooth and handsome.
paragraph.target: 彼の背中はカジキのように青く、腹は銀色で、皮膚は滑らかで美しかった。

paragraph.source: He was built as a sword fish except for his huge jaws which were tight shut now as he swam fast, just under the surface with his high dorsal fin knifing through the water without wavering.
paragraph.target: 彼はカジキのような体つきだったが、今は大きな顎をきっちり閉じて速く泳いでおり、高くそびえる背びれが水面すれすれを揺るがずに切り裂いていた。

paragraph.source: Inside the closed double lip of his jaws all of his eight rows of teeth were slanted inwards.
paragraph.target: 閉じた二重の唇の内側には、八列の歯がすべて内側に傾いていた。

paragraph.source: They were not the ordinary pyramid-shaped teeth of most sharks.
paragraph.target: それらはほとんどのサメの普通のピラミッド型の歯ではなかった。

paragraph.source: They were shaped like a man's fingers when they are crisped like claws.
paragraph.target: それらは、人の指が爪のように曲がった形をしていた。

paragraph.source: They were nearly as long as the fingers of the old man and they had razor-sharp cutting edges on both sides.
paragraph.target: それらは老人の指とほぼ同じ長さで、両側に鋭い刃のような切れ味のある縁があった。

paragraph.source: This was a fish built to feed on all the fishes in the sea, that were so fast and strong and well armed that they had no other enemy.
paragraph.target: これは海のすべての魚を捕食するために造られた魚であり、その魚たちは非常に速く強く、よく武装していて他に敵はいなかった。

paragraph.source: Now he speeded up as he smelled the fresher scent and his blue dorsal fin cut the water.
paragraph.target: 今、彼は新鮮な匂いを嗅ぎつけて速度を上げ、青い背びれが水を切った。

paragraph.source: When the old man saw him coming he knew that this was a shark that had no fear at all and would do exactly what he wished.
paragraph.target: 老人はそれが近づいてくるのを見て、このサメはまったく恐れを知らず、自分の思うままに動くだろうと知った。

paragraph.source: He prepared the harpoon and made the rope fast while he watched the shark come on.
paragraph.target: 彼は銛を用意し、ロープをしっかりと結びつけながら、サメが近づいてくるのを見守った。

paragraph.source: The rope was short as it lacked what he had cut away to lash the fish.
paragraph.target: ロープは短かった。魚を縛るために切り落とした部分がなかったからだ。

paragraph.source: The old man's head was clear and good now and he was full of resolution but he had little hope.
paragraph.target: 老人の頭は今やすっきりとしていて冴えており、決意に満ちていたが、ほとんど望みはなかった。

paragraph.source: It was too good to last, he thought.
paragraph.target: それはあまりにうまくいきすぎて長くは続かないと思った。

paragraph.source: He took one look at the great fish as he watched the shark close in.
paragraph.target: サメが近づくのを見ながら、彼は大きな魚を一目見た。

paragraph.source: It might as well have been a dream, he thought.
paragraph.target: それはまるで夢のようだと思った。

paragraph.source: I cannot keep him from hitting me but maybe I can get him.
paragraph.target: 奴が私に襲いかかるのを防ぐことはできないが、もしかしたら奴を仕留められるかもしれない。

paragraph.source: Dentuso, he thought.
paragraph.target: デントゥーソ、と思った。

paragraph.source: Bad luck to your mother.
paragraph.target: お前の母親に不運あれ。

paragraph.source: The shark closed fast astern and when he hit the fish the old man saw his mouth open and his strange eyes and the clicking chop of the teeth as he drove forward in the meat just above the tail.
paragraph.target: サメは急速に後方から近づき、魚にぶつかると、老人はサメの口が開き、奇妙な目と尾のすぐ上の肉に食い込む歯のカチカチという音を見た。

paragraph.source: The shark's head was out of water and his back was coming out and the old man could hear the noise of skin and flesh ripping on the big fish when he rammed the harpoon down onto the shark's head at a spot where the line between his eyes intersected with the line that ran straight back from his nose.
paragraph.target: サメの頭は水面から出ており、背中も浮き上がっていた。老人は大きな魚の皮膚と肉が裂ける音を聞きながら、サメの頭に銛を突き刺した。その場所は、目と目の間の線と鼻からまっすぐ後ろに伸びる線が交差するところだった。

paragraph.source: There were no such lines.
paragraph.target: しかし、そんな線は存在しなかった。

paragraph.source: There was only the heavy sharp blue head and the big eyes and the clicking, thrusting all-swallowing jaws.
paragraph.target: そこにあったのは、重く鋭い青い頭と大きな目、そしてカチカチと音を立てて突き出す、すべてを飲み込む顎だけだった。

paragraph.source: But that was the location of the brain and the old man hit it.
paragraph.target: だがそこが脳の位置であり、老人はそこを打った。

paragraph.source: He hit it with his blood mushed hands driving a good harpoon with all his strength.
paragraph.target: 彼は血でぐちゃぐちゃになった手で、全力を込めて銛を突き刺した。

paragraph.source: He hit it without hope but with resolution and complete malignancy.
paragraph.target: 彼は希望を持たずに、しかし決意と完全な悪意をもってそれを打った。

paragraph.source: The shark swung over and the old man saw his eye was not alive and then he swung over once again, wrapping himself in two loops of the rope.
paragraph.target: サメは身を翻し、老人はその目が生きていないことに気づいた。そして再び身を翻し、縄を二重に巻きつけた。

paragraph.source: The old man knew that he was dead but the shark would not accept it.
paragraph.target: 老人はサメが死んでいることを知っていたが、サメはそれを認めようとはしなかった。

paragraph.source: Then, on his back, with his tail lashing and his jaws clicking, the shark plowed over the water as a speed-boat does.
paragraph.target: そして、背中を向けて尾を激しく打ちつけ、顎を鳴らしながら、サメは水面を高速艇のようにかき分けて進んだ。

paragraph.source: The water was white where his tail beat it and three-quarters of his body was clear above the water when the rope came taut, shivered, and then snapped.
paragraph.target: 尾が水を打つところは白く泡立ち、体の四分の三が水面からはっきりと見えたとき、縄は張りつめて震え、そして切れた。

paragraph.source: The shark lay quietly for a little while on the surface and the old man watched him.
paragraph.target: サメはしばらくの間、水面で静かに横たわり、老人はそれを見つめていた。

paragraph.source: Then he went down very slowly.
paragraph.target: そしてゆっくりと沈んでいった。

paragraph.source: “He took about forty pounds,” the old man said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「だいたい四十ポンドほど取られた」と老人は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: He took my harpoon too and all the rope, he thought, and now my fish bleeds again and there will be others.
paragraph.target: 「やつは私の銛も縄も全部持っていった」と彼は思った。「そして今また私の魚は血を流している、これからもほかの魚が現れるだろう」と。

paragraph.source: He did not like to look at the fish anymore since he had been mutilated.
paragraph.target: 魚が傷つけられてから、彼はもう魚を見るのを好まなかった。

paragraph.source: When the fish had been hit it was as though he himself were hit.
paragraph.target: 魚が打たれたとき、それはまるで自分自身が打たれたかのようだった。

paragraph.source: But I killed the shark that hit my fish, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、魚を襲ったサメは俺が殺したのだ、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: And he was the biggest dentuso that I have ever seen.
paragraph.target: そしてあれは、これまでに見た中で最大のデントゥーソだった。

paragraph.source: And God knows that I have seen big ones.
paragraph.target: 神も知っている、俺は大きなサメをたくさん見てきたのだと。

paragraph.source: It was too good to last, he thought.
paragraph.target: それはあまりにも良すぎて長くは続かないと思った。

paragraph.source: I wish it had been a dream now and that I had never hooked the fish and was alone in bed on the newspapers.
paragraph.target: 今それが夢であって、魚にかからず、新聞紙の上で一人で寝ていたらよかったのにと思った。

paragraph.source: “But man is not made for defeat,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「しかし人間は敗北するために作られてはいない」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “A man can be destroyed but not defeated.”
paragraph.target: 「人は滅びることはあっても、敗北はしない。」

paragraph.source: I am sorry that I killed the fish though, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、魚を殺してしまったことは残念だと彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Now the bad time is coming and I do not even have the harpoon.
paragraph.target: 今や悪い時が来ている。しかも私は銛すら持っていない。

paragraph.source: The dentuso is cruel and able and strong and intelligent.
paragraph.target: そのデントゥーソは残酷で有能で強く、そして賢い。

paragraph.source: But I was more intelligent that he was.
paragraph.target: しかし私は彼よりも賢かった。

paragraph.source: Perhaps not, he thought.
paragraph.target: いや、そうではないかもしれないと彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Perhaps I was only better armed.
paragraph.target: おそらく私はただ武器をよりよく持っていただけだ。

paragraph.source: “Don't think, old man,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「考えるな、老人よ」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “Sail on this course and take it when it comes.”
paragraph.target: 「この方角に進み、来たときにそれをつかめ。」

paragraph.source: But I must think, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、考えなければならない、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Because it is all I have left.
paragraph.target: なぜなら、それが自分に残されたすべてだからだ。

paragraph.source: That and baseball.
paragraph.target: それと野球だけだ。

paragraph.source: I wonder how the great DiMaggio would have liked the way I hit him in the brain?
paragraph.target: 偉大なディマジオは、私が彼の脳を打ったやり方をどう思っただろうか？

paragraph.source: It was no great thing, he thought.
paragraph.target: 大したことではない、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Any man could do it.
paragraph.target: 誰にでもできることだ。

paragraph.source: But do you think my hands were as great a handicap as the bone spurs?
paragraph.target: だが、骨のとげほど手が大きな障害だったと思うか？

paragraph.source: I cannot know.
paragraph.target: わからない。

paragraph.source: I never had anything wrong with my heel except the time the sting ray stung it when I stepped on him when swimming and paralyzed the lower leg and made the unbearable pain.
paragraph.target: かかとに問題があったことはなかった。ただ、泳いでいるときにエイを踏んで刺され、下腿が麻痺し耐え難い痛みを味わったことがあるだけだ。

paragraph.source: “Think about something cheerful, old man,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「楽しいことを考えろ、老人よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Every minute now you are closer to home.
paragraph.target: 「今や一分一分が家に近づいているのだ。

paragraph.source: You sail lighter for the loss of forty pounds.”
paragraph.target: 四十ポンドも減って、船は軽くなっている。」

paragraph.source: He knew quite well the pattern of what could happen when he reached the inner part of the current.
paragraph.target: 彼は、流れの内側に入ったときに何が起こるかの様子をよく知っていた。

paragraph.source: But there was nothing to be done now.
paragraph.target: しかし、今はもうどうすることもできなかった。

paragraph.source: “Yes there is,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「あるさ」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “I can lash my knife to the butt of one of the oars.”
paragraph.target: 「ナイフを櫂の柄の部分に縛りつけることができる。」

paragraph.source: So he did that with the tiller under his arm and the sheet of the sail under his foot.
paragraph.target: そこで彼は舵を脇に挟み、帆の綱を足の下に置いてそれを行った。

paragraph.source: “Now,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「さて」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “I am still an old man.
paragraph.target: 「私はまだ老人だ。

paragraph.source: But I am not unarmed.”
paragraph.target: だが無防備ではない。」

paragraph.source: The breeze was fresh now and he sailed on well.
paragraph.target: 風は今やさわやかで、彼は順調に帆走した。

paragraph.source: He watched only the forward part of the fish and some of his hope returned.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚の前方部分だけを見つめ、少しばかり希望が戻ってきた。

paragraph.source: It is silly not to hope, he thought.
paragraph.target: 希望しないのは愚かなことだと、彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Besides I believe it is a sin.
paragraph.target: それに、それは罪だと信じている。

paragraph.source: Do not think about sin, he thought.
paragraph.target: 罪のことは考えるな、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: There are enough problems now without sin.
paragraph.target: 今は罪がなくても十分に問題があるのだから。

paragraph.source: Also I have no understanding of it.
paragraph.target: それに、私はそれを理解していない。

paragraph.source: I have no understanding of it and I am not sure that I believe in it.
paragraph.target: 私はそれを理解していないし、それを信じているかどうかも確かではない。

paragraph.source: Perhaps it was a sin to kill the fish.
paragraph.target: 魚を殺すことは罪だったのかもしれない。

paragraph.source: I suppose it was even though I did it to keep me alive and feed many people.
paragraph.target: 生き延びるために、そして多くの人に食べさせるためにそうしたのだが、それでも罪だったのだろうと思う。

paragraph.source: But then everything is a sin.
paragraph.target: しかしそうなると、すべてが罪ということになる。

paragraph.source: Do not think about sin.
paragraph.target: 罪のことは考えるな。

paragraph.source: It is much too late for that and there are people who are paid to do it.
paragraph.target: そんなことを考えるにはもう遅すぎるし、それを考えるために給料をもらっている人たちがいる。

paragraph.source: Let them think about it.
paragraph.target: 彼らに考えさせておけ。

paragraph.source: You were born to be a fisherman as the fish was born to be a fish.
paragraph.target: おまえは漁師として生まれたのだ、魚が魚として生まれたようにな。

paragraph.source: San Pedro was a fisherman as was the father of the great DiMaggio.
paragraph.target: サン・ペドロも漁師だったし、偉大なディマジオの父もそうだった。

paragraph.source: But he liked to think about all things that he was involved in and since there was nothing to read and he did not have a radio, he thought much and he kept on thinking about sin.
paragraph.target: しかし彼は、自分が関わるすべてのことを考えるのが好きだった。読むものもなく、ラジオもなかったので、彼は多く考え、罪について考え続けた。

paragraph.source: You did not kill the fish only to keep alive and to sell for food, he thought.
paragraph.target: 「おまえは魚を、生きるためだけに、食べ物として売るためだけに殺したのではない」と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: You killed him for pride and because you are a fisherman.
paragraph.target: おまえは誇りのために、そして漁師だからこそ彼を殺したのだ。

paragraph.source: You loved him when he was alive and you loved him after.
paragraph.target: 生きているときも愛し、死んだあとも愛した。

paragraph.source: It you love him, it is not a sin to kill him.
paragraph.target: もしおまえが彼を愛しているなら、殺すことは罪ではない。

paragraph.source: Or is it more?
paragraph.target: それとも、もっと深いことなのか？

paragraph.source: “You think too much, old man,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「考えすぎだよ、老人」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: But you enjoyed killing the dentuso, he thought.
paragraph.target: しかし、おまえはデントゥーソを殺すことを楽しんだのだ、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: He lives on the live fish as you do.
paragraph.target: 彼はおまえと同じように生きている魚を食べて生きている。

paragraph.source: He is not a scavenger nor just a moving appetite as some sharks are.
paragraph.target: 彼は一部のサメのような掃除屋でもなく、ただ動き回る食欲でもない。

paragraph.source: He is beautiful and noble and knows no fear of anything.
paragraph.target: 彼は美しく高貴で、何も恐れを知らない。

paragraph.source: “I killed him in self-defense,” the old man said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「私は自己防衛のために彼を殺したのだ」と老人は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “And I killed him well.”
paragraph.target: 「そして、私はうまく殺したのだ。」

paragraph.source: Besides, he thought, everything kills everything else in some way.
paragraph.target: それに、と彼は思った、すべてのものは何らかの形で他のすべてを殺している。

paragraph.source: Fishing kills me exactly as it keeps me alive.
paragraph.target: 漁は私を殺すが、同時に私を生かしてもいる。

paragraph.source: The boy keeps me alive, he thought.
paragraph.target: 少年が私を生かしている、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: I must not deceive myself too much.
paragraph.target: 自分をあまり騙してはいけない。

paragraph.source: He leaned over the side and pulled loose a piece of the meat of the fish where the shark had cut him.
paragraph.target: 彼は船の側面に身を乗り出し、サメに切られた魚の肉の一片を引きはがした。

paragraph.source: He chewed it and noted its quality and its good taste.
paragraph.target: それを噛んで、その質と良い味を確かめた。

paragraph.source: It was firm and juicy, like meat, but it was not red.
paragraph.target: それは肉のようにしっかりとしていてジューシーだったが、赤くはなかった。

paragraph.source: There was no stringiness in it and he knew that it would bring the highest price in the market.
paragraph.target: 繊維質はなく、市場で最高値がつくことを彼は知っていた。

paragraph.source: But there was no way to keep its scent out of the water and the old man knew that a very bad time was coming.
paragraph.target: しかし、その匂いを水中に漏らさない方法はなく、老人は非常に悪い時が近づいていることを悟った。

paragraph.source: The breeze was steady.
paragraph.target: そよ風は一定していた。

paragraph.source: It had backed a little further into the north-east and he knew that meant that it would not fall off.
paragraph.target: 風は少し北東の方へと戻っており、彼はそれが風が弱まらないことを意味していると知っていた。

paragraph.source: The old man looked ahead of him but he could see no sails nor could he see the hull nor the smoke of any ship.
paragraph.target: 老人は前方を見たが、帆も船体も、どの船の煙も見えなかった。

paragraph.source: There were only the flying fish that went up from his bow sailing away to either side and the yellow patches of gulf-weed.
paragraph.target: 彼の船首から飛び上がり左右に飛び去るトビウオと、黄色い海藻の群れだけがあった。

paragraph.source: He could not even see a bird.
paragraph.target: 鳥さえも見えなかった。

paragraph.source: He had sailed for two hours, resting in the stern and sometimes chewing a bit of the meat from the marlin, trying to rest and to be strong, when he saw the first of the two sharks.
paragraph.target: 彼は二時間航海していた。船尾で休みながら、時折マカジキの肉を少しかじって、休息を取りつつ力を保とうとしていた。そのとき、二匹のサメのうちの一匹を見つけた。

paragraph.source: “Ay,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「ああ」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: There is no translation for this word and perhaps it is just a noise such as a man might make, involuntarily, feeling the nail go through his hands and into the wood.
paragraph.target: この言葉に訳語はなく、おそらくは、釘が手を貫いて木に刺さるのを感じて、男が無意識に発するような音にすぎないのだろう。

paragraph.source: “Galanos,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「ガラノス」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: He had seen the second fin now coming up behind the first and had identified them as shovel-nosed sharks by the brown, triangular fin and the sweeping movements of the tail.
paragraph.target: 彼は今や最初のものの後ろから二つ目のひれが現れるのを見て、それらが茶色く三角形のひれと尾の大きな動きから、シャベル鼻のサメだと見分けていた。

paragraph.source: They had the scent and were excited and in the stupidity of their great hunger they were losing and finding the scent in their excitement.
paragraph.target: 彼らは匂いを感じて興奮しており、その大きな飢えの愚かさのために、興奮の中で匂いを見失ったりまた見つけたりしていた。

paragraph.source: But they were closing all the time.
paragraph.target: しかし彼らは絶えず近づいてきていた。

paragraph.source: The old man made the sheet fast and jammed the tiller.
paragraph.target: 老人は帆綱をしっかりと固定し、舵棒を挟み込んだ。

paragraph.source: Then he took up the oar with the knife lashed to it.
paragraph.target: それから、ナイフを縛りつけた櫂を手に取った。

paragraph.source: He lifted it as lightly as he could because his hands rebelled at the pain.
paragraph.target: 手の痛みに抵抗されながらも、できるだけ軽くそれを持ち上げた。

paragraph.source: Then he opened and closed them on it lightly to loosen them.
paragraph.target: 次に、手を軽く開閉してほぐした。

paragraph.source: He closed them firmly so they would take the pain now and would not flinch and watched the sharks come.
paragraph.target: 痛みを今受け入れてひるまないように、しっかりと握り締め、サメが近づくのを見つめた。

paragraph.source: He could see their wide, flattened, shovel-pointed heads now and their white-tipped wide pectoral fins.
paragraph.target: 彼は今や、幅広く平らでシャベルのように尖った頭と、白い先端の幅広い胸びれを見分けることができた。

paragraph.source: They were hateful sharks, bad smelling, scavengers as well as killers, and when they were hungry they would bite at an oar or the rudder of a boat.
paragraph.target: それらは憎らしいサメで、悪臭を放ち、死肉あさりでありながらも殺し屋でもあった。飢えれば櫂や船の舵を噛みつくこともあった。

paragraph.source: It was these sharks that would cut the turtles' legs and flippers off when the turtles were asleep on the surface, and they would hit a man in the water, if they were hungry, even if the man had no smell of fish blood nor of fish slime on him.
paragraph.target: これらのサメは、海面で眠るウミガメの脚やひれを切り落とし、飢えていれば魚の血やぬめりの匂いがなくても、水中の人間に襲いかかることもあった。

paragraph.source: “Ay,” the old man said.
paragraph.target: 「ああ」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: “Galanos.
paragraph.target: 「ガラノス、

paragraph.source: Come on, Galanos.”
paragraph.target: 来い、ガラノス。」

paragraph.source: They came.
paragraph.target: 彼らはやって来た。

paragraph.source: But they did not come as the Mako had come.
paragraph.target: しかし、彼らはマコザメが来たときのようには来なかった。

paragraph.source: One turned and went out of sight under the skiff and the old man could feel the skiff shake as he jerked and pulled on the fish.
paragraph.target: 一匹は方向を変え、小舟の下に姿を消したが、老人は魚を強く引くたびに小舟が揺れるのを感じた。

paragraph.source: The other watched the old man with his slitted yellow eyes and then came in fast with his half circle of jaws wide to hit the fish where he had already been bitten.
paragraph.target: もう一匹は細く裂けた黄色い目で老人を見つめ、そして半円形の大きな顎を広げて、すでに噛みつかれていた魚の部分を狙って素早く近づいてきた。

paragraph.source: The line showed clearly on the top of his brown head and back where the brain joined the spinal cord and the old man drove the knife on the oar into the juncture, withdrew it, and drove it in again into the shark's yellow cat-like eyes.
paragraph.target: 脳と脊髄がつながる茶色い頭頂部と背中には釣り糸の跡がはっきりと見え、老人は櫂に縛りつけたナイフをその接合部に突き刺し、引き抜いてから再びそのナイフをサメの黄色く猫のような目に突き立てた。

paragraph.source: The shark let go of the fish and slid down, swallowing what he had taken as he died.
paragraph.target: サメは魚を放し、死にゆく中で咥えていたものを飲み込みながら滑り落ちていった。

paragraph.source: The skiff was still shaking with the destruction the other shark was doing to the fish and the old man let go the sheet so that the skiff would swing broadside and bring the shark out from under.
paragraph.target: 小舟はまだ、もう一匹のサメが魚に加えている破壊で揺れていた。老人はシートを緩めて、小舟が横向きに揺れてサメを下から引き出すようにした。

paragraph.source: When he saw the shark he leaned over the side and punched at him.
paragraph.target: サメを見つけると、老人は舷側に身を乗り出して拳を振り下ろした。

paragraph.source: He hit only meat and the hide was set hard and he barely got the knife in.
paragraph.target: 拳が当たったのは肉だけで、皮膚は硬く引き締まっており、かろうじてナイフを刺し込んだ。

paragraph.source: The blow hurt not only his hands but his shoulder too.
paragraph.target: その一撃は手だけでなく肩も痛めた。

paragraph.source: But the shark came up fast with his head out and the old man hit him squarely in the center of his flat-topped head as his nose came out of water and lay against the fish.
paragraph.target: しかしサメは頭を水面に出して素早く浮上し、老人はその平らな頭の中央を正確に打った。サメの鼻は水面から出て魚に触れていた。

paragraph.source: The old man withdrew the blade and punched the shark exactly in the same spot again.
paragraph.target: 老人は刃を引き抜き、同じ場所をもう一度拳で打った。

paragraph.source: He still hung to the fish with his jaws hooked and the old man stabbed him in his left eye.
paragraph.target: サメはまだ顎を魚にかけてしがみついており、老人は左目をナイフで突き刺した。

paragraph.source: The shark still hung there.
paragraph.target: サメはそれでもそこにしがみついていた。

paragraph.source: “No?” the old man said and he drove the blade between the vertebrae and the brain.
paragraph.target: 「違うか？」と老人は言い、刃を脊椎と脳の間に突き刺した。

paragraph.source: It was an easy shot now and he felt the cartilage sever.
paragraph.target: 今や簡単な一撃で、軟骨が切れるのを感じた。

paragraph.source: The old man reversed the oar and put the blade between the shark's jaws to open them.
paragraph.target: 老人は櫂を逆さにして、刃をサメの顎の間に差し入れて開かせた。

paragraph.source: He twisted the blade and as the shark slid loose he said, “Go on, galano. Slide down a mile deep. Go see your friend, or maybe it's your mother.”
paragraph.target: 刃をひねるとサメは滑り落ち、老人は言った。「行け、ガラノ。深さ一マイルまで滑り降りろ。友達に会いに行け、あるいはお前の母親かもしれないな。」

paragraph.source: The old man wiped the blade of his knife and laid down the oar.
paragraph.target: 老人はナイフの刃を拭き、櫂を置いた。

paragraph.source: Then he found the sheet and the sail filled and he brought the skiff onto her course.
paragraph.target: それから帆綱を見つけて帆を張り、小舟を進路に乗せた。

paragraph.source: “They must have taken a quarter of him and of the best meat,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「彼らはきっと、魚の四分の一と一番良い肉を持っていったに違いない」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “I wish it were a dream and that I had never hooked him.
paragraph.target: 「夢であって、あの魚にかからなければよかったのにと思う。

paragraph.source: I'm sorry about it, fish.
paragraph.target: ごめんよ、魚よ。

paragraph.source: It makes everything wrong.”
paragraph.target: すべてが台無しになってしまう。」

paragraph.source: He stopped and he did not want to look at the fish now.
paragraph.target: 彼は言葉を止め、今は魚を見る気になれなかった。

paragraph.source: Drained of blood and awash he looked the colour of the silver backing of a mirror and his stripes still showed.
paragraph.target: 血を抜かれ、波に漂うその魚は、鏡の銀色の裏面のような色をしていて、まだ縞模様が見えていた。

paragraph.source: “I shouldn't have gone out so far, fish,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「そんなに遠くまで出るべきではなかった、魚よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Neither for you nor for me.
paragraph.target: 「君のためにも、僕のためにも。」

paragraph.source: I'm sorry, fish.”
paragraph.target: 「すまない、魚よ。」

paragraph.source: Now, he said to himself.
paragraph.target: 今だ、と彼は自分に言った。

paragraph.source: Look to the lashing on the knife and see if it has been cut.
paragraph.target: ナイフの縛り目を見て、切られていないか確かめろ。

paragraph.source: Then get your hand in order because there still is more to come.
paragraph.target: それから手を整えろ、まだこれからがあるのだから。

paragraph.source: “I wish I had a stone for the knife,” the old man said after he had checked the lashing on the oar butt.
paragraph.target: 「ナイフを研ぐ石があればなあ」と老人は櫂の柄の縛りを確かめた後に言った。

paragraph.source: “I should have brought a stone.”
paragraph.target: 「石を持ってくるべきだった。」

paragraph.source: You should have brought many things, he thought.
paragraph.target: いろいろなものを持ってくるべきだった、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: But you did not bring them, old man.
paragraph.target: だが持ってこなかったのだ、老人よ。

paragraph.source: Now is no time to think of what you do not have.
paragraph.target: 今は持っていないものを考える時ではない。

paragraph.source: Think of what you can do with what there is.
paragraph.target: あるもので何ができるかを考えろ。

paragraph.source: “You give me much good counsel,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「ずいぶんと良い助言をくれるな」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “I'm tired of it.”
paragraph.target: 「もううんざりだ。」

paragraph.source: He held the tiller under his arm and soaked both his hands in the water as the skiff drove forward.
paragraph.target: 彼は舵棒を脇に抱え、小舟が前へ進む間、両手を水に浸した。

paragraph.source: “God knows how much that last one took,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「神のみぞ知る、あの最後の一匹がどれほど奪ったか」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “But she's much lighter now.”
paragraph.target: 「だが今はずっと軽くなっている。」

paragraph.source: He did not want to think of the mutilated under-side of the fish.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚の傷ついた腹側のことを考えたくなかった。

paragraph.source: He knew that each of the jerking bumps of the shark had been meat torn away and that the fish now made a trail for all sharks as wide as a highway through the sea.
paragraph.target: 彼は、サメのひとつひとつの激しい突きが肉を引き裂いたものであり、その魚が今や海の中に高速道路のようにサメたちのための跡を作っていることを知っていた。

paragraph.source: He was a fish to keep a man all winter, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は冬の間ずっと男を養える魚だと思った。

paragraph.source: Don't think of that.
paragraph.target: そんなことは考えるな。

paragraph.source: Just rest and try to get your hands in shape to defend what is left of him.
paragraph.target: ただ休んで、残った魚を守るために手を整えろ。

paragraph.source: The blood smell from my hands means nothing now with all that scent in the water.
paragraph.target: 水中にあれだけ匂いがあるのに、手からする血の匂いはもう何の意味もない。

paragraph.source: Besides they do not bleed much.
paragraph.target: それに、あまり血は出ていない。

paragraph.source: There is nothing cut that means anything.
paragraph.target: 重要な部分が切られているわけではない。

paragraph.source: The bleeding may keep the left from cramping.
paragraph.target: 出血が残った部分のけいれんを防いでいるのかもしれない。

paragraph.source: What can I think of now? he thought.
paragraph.target: 今、何を考えられるだろうか？と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Nothing.
paragraph.target: 何もない。

paragraph.source: I must think of nothing and wait for the next ones.
paragraph.target: 何も考えずに、次のやつらを待たなければならない。

paragraph.source: I wish it had really been a dream, he thought.
paragraph.target: 本当に夢だったらよかったのに、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: But who knows? It might have turned out well.
paragraph.target: しかし、誰にわかるだろう？うまくいったかもしれない。

paragraph.source: The next shark that came was a single shovel-nose.
paragraph.target: 次にやってきたサメは一匹のシャベルノーズだった。

paragraph.source: He came like a pig to the trough if a pig had a mouth so wide that you could put your head in it.
paragraph.target: それは、もし豚の口が頭を入れられるほど大きければ、豚が水槽に突進するようにやってきた。

paragraph.source: The old man let him hit the fish and then drove the knife on the oar down into his brain.
paragraph.target: 老人はサメに魚を襲わせてから、櫂につけたナイフをその頭に突き刺した。

paragraph.source: But the shark jerked backwards as he rolled and the knife blade snapped.
paragraph.target: しかしサメは身をよじって後ろに跳ね返り、ナイフの刃は折れてしまった。

paragraph.source: The old man settled himself to steer.
paragraph.target: 老人は舵を取る体勢を整えた。

paragraph.source: He did not even watch the big shark sinking slowly in the water, showing first life-size, then small, then tiny.
paragraph.target: 彼は大きなサメがゆっくりと水中に沈んでいくのを、最初は実物大に、次に小さく、そしてさらに小さくなるのを見もしなかった。

paragraph.source: That always fascinated the old man.
paragraph.target: それはいつも老人を魅了していた。

paragraph.source: But he did not even watch it now.
paragraph.target: しかし今はそれすら見なかった。

paragraph.source: “I have the gaff now,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「今はガフがある」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “But it will do no good.
paragraph.target: 「だが、それは役に立たないだろう。

paragraph.source: I have the two oars and the tiller and the short club.”
paragraph.target: 二本の櫂と舵棒と短いこん棒がある。」

paragraph.source: Now they have beaten me, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今や彼らに打ち負かされた、と老人は思った。

paragraph.source: I am too old to club sharks to death.
paragraph.target: 私はサメをこん棒で叩き殺すには年を取りすぎている。

paragraph.source: But I will try it as long as I have the oars and the short club and the tiller.
paragraph.target: だが、櫂と短いこん棒と舵棒がある限りは、それを試みようと思う。

paragraph.source: He put his hands in the water again to soak them.
paragraph.target: 彼は再び手を水に入れて浸した。

paragraph.source: It was getting late in the afternoon and he saw nothing but the sea and the sky.
paragraph.target: 午後も遅くなり、彼の目に映るのは海と空だけだった。

paragraph.source: There was more wind in the sky than there had been, and soon he hoped that he would see land.
paragraph.target: 空には以前より風が強くなっており、彼はすぐに陸が見えることを願った。

paragraph.source: “You're tired, old man,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「疲れているな、老人よ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “You're tired inside.”
paragraph.target: 「内側から疲れているのだ。」

paragraph.source: The sharks did not hit him again until just before sunset.
paragraph.target: サメは日没直前まで再び彼に襲いかからなかった。

paragraph.source: The old man saw the brown fins coming along the wide trail the fish must make in the water.
paragraph.target: 老人は、魚が水中に作るに違いない広い跡に沿って茶色いひれが近づいてくるのを見た。

paragraph.source: They were not even quartering on the scent.
paragraph.target: それらは匂いを頼りに斜めに近づいているわけでもなかった。

paragraph.source: They were headed straight for the skiff swimming side by side.
paragraph.target: それらは並んで泳ぎながら小舟にまっすぐ向かっていた。

paragraph.source: He jammed the tiller, made the sheet fast and reached under the stern for the club.
paragraph.target: 彼は舵棒をしっかりと固定し、帆綱を締めてから、船尾の下に手を伸ばしてこん棒を取った。

paragraph.source: It was an oar handle from a broken oar sawed off to about two and a half feet in length.
paragraph.target: それは折れた櫂の柄の部分で、約二フィート半の長さに切り落とされたものだった。

paragraph.source: He could only use it effectively with one hand because of the grip of the handle and he took good hold of it with his right hand, flexing his hand on it, as he watched the sharks come.
paragraph.target: 柄の握りの形状のために片手でしか効果的に使えなかったが、彼は右手でしっかりと握り、手をしならせながらサメが近づくのを見つめた。

paragraph.source: They were both galanos.
paragraph.target: それらはどちらもガラノスだった。

paragraph.source: I must let the first one get a good hold and hit him on the point of the nose or straight across the top of the head, he thought.
paragraph.target: 最初の一匹にしっかりと噛みつかせてから、鼻先か頭のてっぺんを真っすぐに打たなければならない、と彼は考えた。

paragraph.source: The two sharks closed together and as he saw the one nearest him open his jaws and sink them into the silver side of the fish, he raised the club high and brought it down heavy and slamming onto the top of the shark's broad head.
paragraph.target: 二匹のサメが一緒に近づき、彼のすぐ近くのサメが口を大きく開けて魚の銀色の側面に噛みつくのを見たとき、彼はこん棒を高く振り上げ、重く振り下ろしてサメの幅広い頭の上を強く打ちつけた。

paragraph.source: He felt the rubbery solidity as the club came down.
paragraph.target: こん棒が降りてくるとき、彼はそれがゴムのように弾力のある堅さを感じた。

paragraph.source: But he felt the rigidity of bone too and he struck the shark once more hard across the point of the nose as he slid down from the fish.
paragraph.target: しかし骨の硬さも感じ、魚から滑り落ちるときにもう一度、鼻先を強く打ちつけた。

paragraph.source: The other shark had been in and out and now came in again with his jaws wide.
paragraph.target: もう一匹のサメは出たり入ったりしていて、今また大きく口を開けて近づいてきた。

paragraph.source: The old man could see pieces of the meat of the fish spilling white from the corner of his jaws as he bumped the fish and closed his jaws.
paragraph.target: 老人は、サメが魚にぶつかり口を閉じるとき、口の端から魚の白い肉のかけらがこぼれ落ちるのが見えた。

paragraph.source: He swung at him and hit only the head and the shark looked at him and wrenched the meat loose.
paragraph.target: 老人は振りかぶって打ちつけたが、当たったのは頭だけで、サメは老人を見て肉を引きちぎった。

paragraph.source: The old man swung the club down on him again as he slipped away to swallow and hit only the heavy solid rubberiness.
paragraph.target: サメが離れて飲み込もうとするのに合わせて、老人は再びこん棒を振り下ろしたが、当たったのは重くて固いゴムのような感触だけだった。

paragraph.source: “Come on, galano,”
paragraph.target: 「さあ、ガラノ、

paragraph.source: the old man said.
paragraph.target: 」と老人は言った。

paragraph.source: “Come in again.”
paragraph.target: 「もう一度かかってこい。」

paragraph.source: The shark came in a rush and the old man hit him as he shut his jaws.
paragraph.target: サメは急に襲いかかり、老人はその顎を閉じる瞬間に打ちつけた。

paragraph.source: He hit him solidly and from as high up as he could raise the club.
paragraph.target: 老人はしっかりと、できるだけ高く棒を振り上げて打ちつけた。

paragraph.source: This time he felt the bone at the base of the brain and he hit him again in the same place while the shark tore the meat loose sluggishly and slid down from the fish.
paragraph.target: 今度は脳の付け根の骨を感じ、サメが肉をのろのろと引きちぎりながら魚から滑り落ちる間に、同じ場所をもう一度打ちつけた。

paragraph.source: The old man watched for him to come again but neither shark showed.
paragraph.target: 老人はまた来るのを見張っていたが、どちらのサメも現れなかった。

paragraph.source: Then he saw one on the surface swimming in circles.
paragraph.target: それから彼は一匹が水面で円を描いて泳いでいるのを見た。

paragraph.source: He did not see the fin of the other.
paragraph.target: もう一匹のひれは見えなかった。

paragraph.source: I could not expect to kill them, he thought.
paragraph.target: 彼は思った。自分には彼らを殺すことは期待できないと。

paragraph.source: I could have in my time.
paragraph.target: かつてならできたかもしれないが。

paragraph.source: But I have hurt them both badly and neither one can feel very good.
paragraph.target: しかし、両方をひどく傷つけたので、どちらもあまり気分は良くないだろう。

paragraph.source: If I could have used a bat with two hands I could have killed the first one surely.
paragraph.target: もし両手でこん棒を使えたなら、最初の一匹は確実に殺せただろう。

paragraph.source: Even now, he thought.
paragraph.target: 今でもそう思った。

paragraph.source: He did not want to look at the fish.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚を見たくなかった。

paragraph.source: He knew that half of him had been destroyed.
paragraph.target: 自分の半分が破壊されてしまったことを彼は知っていた。

paragraph.source: The sun had gone down while he had been in the fight with the sharks.
paragraph.target: サメとの戦いの間に太陽は沈んでしまっていた。

paragraph.source: “It will be dark soon,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「もうすぐ暗くなる」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Then I should see the glow of Havana.
paragraph.target: 「そうしたらハバナの灯りが見えるはずだ。

paragraph.source: If I am too far to the eastward I will see the lights of one of the new beaches.”
paragraph.target: もし東の方へ行きすぎていれば、新しい海岸の灯りが見えるだろう」

paragraph.source: I cannot be too far out now, he thought.
paragraph.target: もうあまり遠くには出ていないはずだ、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: I hope no one has been too worried.
paragraph.target: 誰もあまり心配していなければいいが。

paragraph.source: There is only the boy to worry, of course.
paragraph.target: 心配するのはもちろん少年だけだ。

paragraph.source: But I am sure he would have confidence.
paragraph.target: だが、彼はきっと自信を持っているだろう。

paragraph.source: Many of the older fishermen will worry.
paragraph.target: 年配の漁師たちは多くが心配するだろう。

paragraph.source: Many others too, he thought.
paragraph.target: 他にも多くの人が、と思った。

paragraph.source: I live in a good town.
paragraph.target: 私はいい町に住んでいる。

paragraph.source: He could not talk to the fish anymore because the fish had been ruined too badly.
paragraph.target: 魚はあまりにもひどく傷ついてしまったので、彼はもう魚に話しかけることができなかった。

paragraph.source: Then something came into his head.
paragraph.target: そのとき、彼の頭に何かが浮かんだ。

paragraph.source: “Half fish,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「半分魚だ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “Fish that you were.
paragraph.target: 「おまえは魚だったのだ。

paragraph.source: I am sorry that I went too far out.
paragraph.target: 遠くまで出過ぎてしまって申し訳ない。

paragraph.source: I ruined us both.
paragraph.target: おまえも俺も台無しにしてしまった。

paragraph.source: But we have killed many sharks, you and I, and ruined many others.
paragraph.target: だが、俺たちはたくさんのサメを殺し、他にも多くを傷つけてきた。

paragraph.source: How many did you ever kill, old fish?
paragraph.target: おまえは今までにいくつ殺したんだ、古い魚よ？

paragraph.source: You do not have that spear on your head for nothing.”
paragraph.target: おまえの頭にあの槍があるのは、無駄じゃないはずだ。」

paragraph.source: He liked to think of the fish and what he could do to a shark if he were swimming free.
paragraph.target: 彼は魚のことを思い浮かべるのが好きだったし、もし自由に泳げたらサメに何ができるかを考えた。

paragraph.source: I should have chopped the bill off to fight them with, he thought.
paragraph.target: 戦うためにそのくちばしを切り落とすべきだった、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: But there was no hatchet and then there was no knife.
paragraph.target: しかし、手斧はなく、そしてナイフもなかった。

paragraph.source: But if I had, and could have lashed it to an oar butt, what a weapon.
paragraph.target: もしそうしていて、それを櫂の柄に縛り付けられたなら、なんて武器になっただろう。

paragraph.source: Then we might have fought them together.
paragraph.target: そうすれば、いっしょに彼らと戦えたかもしれない。

paragraph.source: What will you do now if they come in the night?
paragraph.target: もし夜に彼らが来たら、今度はどうするつもりだ？

paragraph.source: What can you do?
paragraph.target: おまえには何ができる？

paragraph.source: “Fight them,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「戦うんだ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: “I'll fight them until I die.”
paragraph.target: 「死ぬまで戦い続ける」

paragraph.source: But in the dark now and no glow showing and no lights and only the wind and the steady pull of the sail he felt that perhaps he was already dead.
paragraph.target: しかし今は暗く、光も見えず、灯りもなく、ただ風と帆の一定の引きだけがある中で、彼はおそらく自分はもう死んでいるのかもしれないと感じた。

paragraph.source: He put his two hands together and felt the palms.
paragraph.target: 彼は両手を合わせて、手のひらを確かめた。

paragraph.source: They were not dead and he could bring the pain of life by simply opening and closing them.
paragraph.target: それらは死んでおらず、ただ開いたり閉じたりするだけで生の痛みを感じることができた。

paragraph.source: He leaned his back against the stern and knew he was not dead.
paragraph.target: 彼は船尾にもたれかかり、自分が死んでいないことを知った。

paragraph.source: His shoulders told him.
paragraph.target: 肩がそれを教えてくれた。

paragraph.source: I have all those prayers I promised if I caught the fish, he thought.
paragraph.target: 魚を捕まえたら捧げると約束した祈りは全部ある、と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: But I am too tired to say them now.
paragraph.target: しかし今は祈るには疲れすぎている。

paragraph.source: I better get the sack and put it over my shoulders.
paragraph.target: 袋を取って肩にかけたほうがいい。

paragraph.source: He lay in the stern and steered and watched for the glow to come in the sky.
paragraph.target: 彼は船尾に横たわり舵を取りながら、空に光が差すのを見つめていた。

paragraph.source: I have half of him, he thought.
paragraph.target: 「魚の半分は手に入れた」と彼は思った。

paragraph.source: Maybe I'll have the luck to bring the forward half in.
paragraph.target: もしかすると、前の半分も持ち帰る幸運があるかもしれない。

paragraph.source: I should have some luck.
paragraph.target: 少しは運があるはずだ。

paragraph.source: No, he said.
paragraph.target: いや、彼は言った。

paragraph.source: You violated your luck when you went too far outside.
paragraph.target: 外海に出すぎて運を裏切ったのだ。

paragraph.source: “Don't be silly,” he said aloud.
paragraph.target: 「ばかげたことを言うな」と彼は声に出して言った。

paragraph.source: “And keep awake and steer.
paragraph.target: 「それに、目を覚まして舵を取れ。

paragraph.source: You may have much luck yet.”
paragraph.target: まだたくさんの運があるかもしれない。」

paragraph.source: “I'd like to buy some if there's any place they sell it,” he said.
paragraph.target: 「もしどこかで売っているなら、いくつか買いたいものだ」と彼は言った。

paragraph.source: What could I buy it with?
